place.name: HARTHILL
place.gazetteerText: HARTHILL, a parish in Great Boughton district, Cheshire; 3 miles S by E of Tattenhall r. station, and 5½ SW by W of Tarporley. It has a post office under Chester. Acres, 481. Real property, £703. Pop., 122. Houses, 22. There is a lake of about 4 acres, called Harthill Pool. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Chester. Value, £114.* Patron, T. T. Drake, Esq. The church is ancient; and there are charities £22. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
